name: Gimlet
instructions: A Gimlet is a classic cocktail known for its simplicity and refreshing taste. To make this tangy cocktail, start by filling the cocktail shaker with ice. Add the gin, freshly squeezed lime juice, and simple syrup to the shaker. Shake well for about 15-20 seconds to chill the mixture. Strain the mixture into a chilled cocktail glass (such as a coupe glass or a martini glass) over fresh ice. Garnish the drink with a lime wheel or a twist.
description: A Gimlet is a classic cocktail known for its simplicity and refreshing taste. It combines gin with simple syrup and lime juice.

name: Gin and Tonic
instructions: The Gin and Tonic is a classic cocktail with a signature copper mug presentation. To craft this drink, start by filling a copper mug or highball glass with ice. Squeeze the juice from half a lime into the glass, and drop the spent lime shell in. Then, pour in 2 oz. of gin. Top it off with approximately 4 oz. of tonic water, or adjust to your preferred level of tonic flavor. Give it a gentle stir to mix the ingredients. To garnish, add a lime wheel or wedge for an extra burst of citrus aroma. The Gin and Tonic is known for its crisp and tangy taste, making it a popular choice for a refreshing and enjoyable cocktail.

name: Merlot
instructions: Merlot is a red wine characterized by its velvety texture, medium to full body, and flavors of ripe plum, cherry, and herbal notes. Enjoy Merlot at a cool room temperature
description: Merlot is a red wine characterized by its velvety texture, medium to full body, and flavors of ripe plum, cherry, and herbal notes.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon
instructions: Cabernet Sauvignon is a robust red wine, renowned for its deep color, firm tannins, and flavors that often include blackcurrant, cherry, and cedar, making it an excellent choice for those who appreciate bold and structured reds. With a potential for aging, Cabernet Sauvignon is versatile, pairing well with hearty dishes or simply enjoyed on its own. Serve at room temperature.
description: Cabernet Sauvignon is a robust red wine, renowned for its deep color, firm tannins, and flavors that often include blackcurrant, cherry, and cedar.

name: Malbec
instructions: Malbec, a red wine originating from France but flourishing notably in Argentina, is known for its plush, dark fruit flavors, velvety texture, and often features notes of plum, black cherry, and chocolate, making it a popular choice for those seeking a smooth and approachable red wine. With its versatility, Malbec pairs well with a range of foods, from grilled meats to hearty pasta dishes, offering a satisfying and flavorful drinking experience. Serve Malbec at a cool room temperature.
description: Malbec, a red wine originating from France but flourishing notably in Argentina, is known for its plush, dark fruit flavors, velvety texture, and often features notes of plum, black cherry, and chocolate.

name: Pilsner
instructions: Pislner is a type of pale lager orignating in the Czech Republic. It has a crisp and dry taste. It is best served cold in a tall narrow glass. When pouring, aim for a moderate and controlled pour to achieve a good balance between beer and head.
description: Pislner is a type of pale lager orignating in the Czech Republic. It has a crisp and dry taste.

name: Lager
instructions: Lager is a light beer orignally from Bavaria. It is best served cold. Aim for a moderate and controlled pour to minimize excessive foaming, resulting in a nice, frothy head. Add lemon or lime garnish if desired.
description: Lager is a light beer orignally from Bavaria.

name: Hard Cider
instructions: Hard cider is made from fermented apple juice. It is commonly served chilled straight from the bottle or can.
description: Hard cider is made from fermented apple juice.
